ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: It was kind of a mix of lecture and virtual seminar.
Since this class had a small amount of people, it often switched to a seminar feel.
none

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I got excellent practice in concision of speaking and writing, and learned lessons about integrity, and the history and heritage of the Air Force.
Introduction to AFROTC and how it works as well as the future for cadets.
Gave me basic skills to get by in customs and courtesies, and introduced me to how the US Air Force works as a military institution through it's mission and history.
customs/courtesies/history of the Air Force
the values and traditions of the Air Force. Also history behind the formation of the Air Force.
I learned basic knowledge that any Air Force officer should know

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: More activities would be nice, but Lt Col Tseng did an excellent job tying in the students.
Since it was mainly a lecture, students did not really get to engage with the course and material.
This course was very well organized. One suggestion I have is for deadlines to be made more clear in the syllabus if anything changes.
It was a great class. I'm not sure how it would be different in an in-person environment

Strengths: We learned essential knowledge and the curriculum was well organized. Weaknesses: The teaching was often monotonous, and despite being graded on our class participation, we were never given opportunities to participate.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: People were cooperative over zoom to allow the course to go smoothly .
I did not feel any gaps in my learning, and so I think the switch to an online learning format was a success.
It went as well as it could for covid. I wish it had been in person.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, this course put me on the right track to officership.
yes

Yes! Whether or not you are in ROTC this is a great course to learn about the foundation of the Air Force and what values they treasure. Likewise you learn about the history and different career paths one may take.
